qas.question: When did the Nigerian film industry begin?
Which African country has the continent's largest movie industry?
Which cities are Nigeria's movie studios located in?
What is the nickname for Nigeria's movie industry?
Where does Nigeria's movie industry rank worldwide?

context: The Nigerian film industry is known as <a3_0>Nollywood<a3_0/> (a portmanteau of Nigeria and Hollywood) and is now the <a4_0>2nd-largest<a4_0/> producer of movies in the world. Nigerian film studios are based in <a2_0>Lagos, Kano and Enugu<a2_0/>, forming a major portion of the local economy of these cities. <a1_0>Nigerian<a1_0/> cinema is Africa's largest movie industry in terms of both value and the number of movies produced per year. Although Nigerian films have been produced since <a0_0>the 1960s<a0_0/>, the country's film industry has been aided by the rise of affordable digital filming and editing technologies.
